nl.uu.cs.ape.sat.models

Class AllModules

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.uu.cs.ape.sat.models.AllModules

  • public class AllModules
extends java.lang.Object
    The AllModules class represent the set of all modules/tools that can be part of our program. Each of them is either Module or AbstractModule.
    Author:
    Vedran Kasalica

    • Constructor Summary

      AllModules() 
      AllModules(java.util.Collection<? extends AbstractModule> modules)
      Create a map-set containing all modules from @modules, omitting the duplicates.

    • Method Detail

      • getModules

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,AbstractModule> getModules()

      • addModule

        public AbstractModule addModule(AbstractModule module)
        Adds the specified element to this set if it is not already present (optional operation) and returns it. More formally, adds the specified element e to this set if the set contains no element e2 such that (e==null ? e2==null : e.equals(e2)). If this set already contains the element, the call leaves the set unchanged and returns the existing element. In combination with the restriction on constructors, this ensures that sets never contain duplicate elements. It also check whether the new element extends the existing one, it that case the existing one is replaced by the extended one.
        Parameters:
        module - - The AbstractModule/Module that needs to be added.
        Returns:
        The element if it's a new one or the existing element if this set contains the specified element.

      • swapAbstractModule2Module

        public void swapAbstractModule2Module(AbstractModule newModule,
                                      AbstractModule oldModule)
        Removes the AbstractModule from the set of all modules and adds the Module element (or vice versa). Swaps the objects in the set of all Modules.
        Parameters:
        newModule - - object that will be added
        oldModule - - object that will be removed

        public AbstractModule get(java.lang.String moduleID)

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        AbstractModule or Module to which the specified key is mapped to, or null if the moduleID has no mappings

      • existsModule

        public boolean existsModule(AbstractModule module)
        Returns true if this set contains the specified element. More formally, returns true if and only if this set contains an element e such that (o==null ? e==null : o.equals(e)).
        Parameters:
        module -
        Returns:
        true if this set contains the specified element

      • modulesConstraints

        public java.lang.String modulesConstraints(SAT_SynthesisEngine synthesisInstance)
        Return a CNF representation of the INPUT and OUTPUT type constraints. Depending on the parameter pipeline, the INPUT constraints will be based on a pipeline or general memory approach.
        Parameters:
        moduleAutomaton - - represents the module automaton
        typeAutomaton - - represent the type automaton
        shared_memory - - if false pipeline approach, otherwise the general memory approach is used
        emptyType - - represents absence of types
        mappings -
        useAllWorkflowInputs - - true if all the inputs given to the workflow should be used
        useAllGeneratedTypes - - true if all the generated types have to be used
        Returns:
        String representation of constraints regarding the required INPUT and OUTPUT types of the modules

      • moduleMutualExclusion

        public java.lang.String moduleMutualExclusion(ModuleAutomaton moduleAutomaton,
                                              AtomMapping mappings)
        Generating the mutual exclusion constraints for each pair of tools from modules (excluding abstract modules from the taxonomy) in each state of moduleAutomaton.
        Parameters:
        moduleAutomaton -
        mappings -
        Returns:
        String representation of constraints

      • moduleMandatoryUsage

        public java.lang.String moduleMandatoryUsage(AllModules annotatedTools,
                                             ModuleAutomaton moduleAutomaton,
                                             AtomMapping mappings)
        Generating the mandatory usage constraints of root module @rootModule in each state of @moduleAutomaton.
        Parameters:
        rootModuleID - - represent the ID of the root module in the module taxonomy
        moduleAutomaton - - module automaton
        mappings -
        Returns:
        String representation of constraints

      • moduleEnforceTaxonomyStructure

        public java.lang.String moduleEnforceTaxonomyStructure(java.lang.String rootModuleID,
                                                       ModuleAutomaton moduleAutomaton,
                                                       AtomMapping mappings)
        Generating the mandatory usage of a submodules in case of the parent module being used, with respect to the Module Taxonomy. The rule starts from the @rootModule and it's valid in each state of @moduleAutomaton.
        Parameters:
        rootModuleID - - represent the ID of the root module in the module taxonomy
        moduleAutomaton - - module automaton
        mappings -
        Returns:
        String representation of constraints enforcing taxonomy classifications
